message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.MM, cs.CL 

The paper deals with the problem of identifying videos on YouTube that are likely to be targeted by coordinated hate attacks. This involves analyzing various aspects of the videos, such as metadata, audio transcripts, and thumbnails, and using an ensemble of classifiers to predict the likelihood of a video being raided. This work involves aspects of social media analysis (cs.SI), cybersecurity (cs.CY), and machine learning (cs.MM). Additionally, the paper deals with natural language processing (cs.CL) and computer vision (cs.CR) techniques for analyzing the content of videos.
